TopicTitle: How To Make A Table On The Forum

Articles.Content:
The Forum BB Code list doesn't include tables, so here is how you can make a table on the forum.

Example:

Usage:

[noparse][table=class: cms_table__grid, width: ###]

[tr][td]value[/td][td]value[/td][/tr]

[tr][td]value[/td][td]value[/td][/tr][/table][/noparse]

where "tr" = Table Row and "td" = Table Cell

Example Usage:

[noparse][TABLE=class: cms_table__grid, width: 500]

[tr] [td]content[/td] [td]content[/td] [/tr]

[tr] [td]content 2[/td] [td]content 2[/td] [/tr]

[/table][/noparse]

Example Output:

[TABLE=class: cms_table__grid, width: 500]

[tr] [td]content[/td] [td]content[/td] [/tr]

[tr] [td]content 2[/td] [td]content 2[/td] [/tr]

[/table]

Edited August 5, 2015 by Endersmens

Well that's strange, it's showing all the built-in BB code and the ones we added, but not tables, and you can't edit the built-in codes.

Why would tables be special and what else is missing?

Key 5char
[noparse]Key[/noparse] is pretty simple. It's tables that need working on. [noparse][noparse]This is noparse-seption. Illuminati Confirmed![/noparse][/noparse]
The key BB-code is there. I'm not sure why the table one is missing, but it's not something that's easily added.

The key BB-code is there. I'm not sure why the table one is missing, but it's not something that's easily added.

Alright, well maybe this thread could be turned into a "How to make Tables" thread then. Thanks for the reply!

Ohhh looks intresting any uses?

Organization. It can be used for scheduling, as a check list, as a feature list, anything you want really. I'll get some examples in a little bit.

Example. The upper part has been organized using an invisible table, and the feature list is a table, too.

More Example. Looks better as if I had it just written there.
